metadata.feature_description: View and manage assigned workflow tasks for content review and approval

steps.action: Navigate to My Work feature via URL http://localhost:8081/en-us/Home/ctl/MyWork/mid/469
steps.expected: My Work page loads showing list of assigned workflow tasks
steps.actual: ModuleLoadException: The file '/DesktopModules/HTML/MyWork.ascx' does not exist. The MyWork control file is missing from the server deployment.

issues: Critical deployment issue: MyWork.ascx file is missing from /DesktopModules/HTML/ directory on the server

steps.action: Attempt to access My Work feature to test filtering
steps.expected: My Work page loads with filter options for task status
steps.actual: Cannot test - MyWork.ascx control file does not exist on server. Feature is completely non-functional.

issues: Feature inaccessible due to missing MyWork.ascx file

steps.action: Attempt to access My Work feature to test bulk operations
steps.expected: My Work page loads and provides bulk approve/reject functionality
steps.actual: Cannot test - MyWork.ascx control file does not exist on server. Feature is completely non-functional.

issues: Feature inaccessible due to missing MyWork.ascx file

observations: The MyWork feature is defined in the module manifest (dnn_HtmlPro.dnn) with controlKey='MyWork' and controlSrc='DesktopModules/HTML/MyWork.ascx'
However, the MyWork.ascx file is NOT deployed to the server at the expected path /DesktopModules/HTML/MyWork.ascx
This appears to be a deployment or packaging issue - the file exists in the module definition but was not included in the actual deployment
Documentation exists for this feature in 'Managing My Workflow Tasks.html' indicating it should display workflow tasks for content review and approval
The module actions menu should contain a 'My Work' option accessible via the view.gif icon according to documentation
All test scenarios for 'My Work Tasks' feature are blocked by this missing file issue
Recommendation: Ensure MyWork.ascx is included in the Resources.zip package during module deployment
